title: FIFA President Sepp Blatter facing suspension
text:
Sepp Blatter Facing Suspension Amid Criminal Investigation Christian Bryant world news | sports news | sepp blatter | fifa sepp blatter | fifa sepp blatter suspended 
Photo Credit: Getty Images / Philipp Schmidli 
FIFA President Sepp Blatter could be on the sidelines for up to three months. FIFA's ethics commission is reportedly considering suspending the embattled president for 90 days as the corruption scandal of soccer's governing body continues. 
Blatter's status as FIFA president is currently up in the air, with some reporters saying Blatter has been "provisionally suspended" and others saying a suspension is forthcoming. What many agree on, though, is that Blatter and UEFA President Michel Platini were both brought up at FIFA's recent ethics commission meeting. 
Blatter is under investigation by Swiss authorities and could still face criminal charges for an alleged "disloyal payment" he made to Platini, who is a FIFA presidential hopeful. (Video via BBC ) 
And, if criminal charges and a suspension weren't enough, Chung Mong-joon — head of South Korea's soccer association and, yes, another FIFA presidential candidate — said he plans to sue Blatter for embezzlement. Chung is facing a nearly two-decade suspension from FIFA for wrongdoing surrounding South Korea's 2022 World Cup bid. (Video via Arirang ) 
Blatter, Platini and Chung have all denied allegations against them. Blatter told a German newspaper Tuesday he doesn't plan on resigning immediately but said he will continue to fight until he steps down — as planned — in February. (Video via France 24 )
